title: NFT Has hit a new low...

comments.comment: One of my fiancee's art pieces got stolen and turned into an NFT without her permission. Thankfully DeviantArt notified her of it, now she's having to prove she's the original owner and creator, and may have to seek out legal actions against the site because they don't require proof of original ownership before selling.
It would be so legendary if Keanu Reeves laughing at NFTs devalued the whole market
The people who made the Stan Lee NFTs should lose access to his account. It's disgusting what they did.
The most infuriating part is that there are digital artists whose artwork gets stolen and turned into an NFT, some filed lawsuits but there are those who actually lost like wtf

i was neutral on NFTs until shortly after they blew up people started stealing artworks from hardworking artists and selling them as NFTs. of course it went as far as stealing a deceased artist's art to sell as NFTs, and of course it's happening again.
NFTs: A brilliant way to separate fools from their money.

The stupidest thing about NFT is that people who promote this think that a ton of people want to own that shit.
They ain't Mona Lisa dude. It's just auto generated character creator output at this point.
Owning a NFT is like buying a Lamborghini then leaving at the dealership, then getting a taxi back home
The fact that someone stole Qinni's (an artist who passed away) art and tried to sell it as an NFT makes me feel sick to my stomach, just seriously evil and gross
We live in a society where a man paid 3k for a jpeg and thought to himself: OMG what a steal!!!
0 dislikes. This video is doing amazingly. Glad 100% of the population agrees with pewdiepie.

I genuinely don't like NFTs. For one, they HAVE stolen art from artists, then sold them as NFTs. They have disrespected Stan Lee. And as someone who loves biology and nature its self, they are harmful to the environment from the TONS of energy they require to make. Like, seriously. I hope this dies off.
I find it ironic that they're making NFT's of the Matrix, when the Matrix is about this idea of being trapped in a virtual unreal world...
Whoever convinced anyone that NFT's are a good investment is an incredible conman

Paying artists for a commission of a specific thing you want: "Can we like talk more about the pricing, i still think it's too much..."
Paying random NFTs: "500K?! THAT'S A STEAL"

I’m glad Pewds spoke up about this. It’s a pretty ridiculous situation and I honestly can’t wait to see these people realize that they wasted away their life savings on digital art that can be easily stolen or reproduced. Atleast with commissions you can get the copyright and the art is to your specifications. And with physical art it’s even better since it’s a physical piece of art you can rent out or lend to galleries
The fact that someone used Stan Lee's twitter account to sell an nft is disgusting

*NFT is all about supporting artists*

Artists : "nft? What tf is that?"
now instead of actual art sold by the actual artist, we have art stolen and sold without artist consent and  big environmental impact. Beautiful. (if you buy jpg you are stupid)

One of the artists I follow on Twitter mentioned how their art was stolen and sold as an NFT. When they tried to reach out to the website these works were being sold on they gave them endless hoops to jump through. During this process, yet another piece of their art was stolen and put up for sale. There was already an issue with art theft. I know it as an artist myself. But the way things are right now, it is SO much easier to make big bucks off of someone else's work without them getting a cent of it.
So... NFTs are basically like adoptables that have been around in the art community since forever, but a "new" crappy corporate scam version? Why
They're practically shaking Stan Lee's dead body for any loose change. This whole thing is thoroughly fucked.

Pewds: "not a scam"

Also Pewds: "You could win a million dollars"
it honestly feels like the NTF's are going to be abused by people who just want to make a quick buck off of someone else's hard work.

Before watching video: "what is NFT?"
Me after watching the video: "I don't like NFT"

Finally an influencer said this, a lot of people thinks that NFTs are serious investments and profitable when it’s not. Big Crypto influencers like Jake Paul, KSI and others are able to take profit because they are able to popularize the NFT, just like how a spoon used by Michael Jackson for example would worth a lot more than a spoon used by a normal guy. It’s a great concept and could be used as a media for artists to sell artwork and collectibles but right now it’s just a cash-grab and a massive scam.
The best application for NFTs: Furries. They commision art for their fursonas, and when they wanna change things up (or need more money) they sell on their existing fursona to others.

As Pewdiepie was talking about Stan Lee being sold, I thought about Bob Ross's documentary. So sad how low people can get when it comes to someones life. Pewdiepie has big brain on huge matters in our world, keep it up
NFTs are a great example of a wonderful idea executed in a terrible way.
Keanu's laugh absolutely broke my soul into pieces. This man's mind is already cyberpunk 42069

What bothers me about NFTs the most is the fact it brings the problem artist have with traditional art is ppl reselling their art for way more than the artist did, and the artist never sees a cent of it.....

The bad : NFT
The good : Keanu Reeves XD
Reality check with Felix is THE BEST thing to watch here.

Hey pewds 5:55 we're not actually laughing about screenshoting an NFT
we're laughing at the NFT owners getting triggered by it.
From what I can tell, Steam and SEGA are the two companies I know that are safe from NFTs (for now)

As Keanu said, the problem is people wanting to own everything instead of just experiencing it, exclusivity is stupid, we as people should want to share the things we like, not hide it from others by buying it.
A lot of people are memeing NFTs but it’s honestly looking like a huge money laundering operation. It’s like how rich people donate to art museum they own.
Taking a screenshot of an nft isn't funny but it makes them mad and I think that's beautiful!

3:00 that is also how I laughed with "Digital scarcity of things that are unique and can't be copied". I'd laugh about as hard if someone told me that dehydrated water is on sale. Who the fuck tells people "digital scarcity is a thing" and expects to be taken seriously?
Let's be honest here, NFT's has never been about the artists, from the get go and i have seen the same with cryptos, all people cared about is how much money they can potentially get out of it.

My main problem with NFTs is how it’s become a way for people to profit rather than make and share their art, it’s literally a pyramid scheme at this point. Not to mention it’s extremely energy intensive and bad for the environment. I think it’s a cool concept but ultimately was ruined by corporations and people looking for cash.

"NFTs have reached a new low"
New Unlocked Achievement: Do the Impossible
NFT"S are biggest scam of this time!

I feel like a boomer who still doesn't understand the full capacity of NFT's and WHY they need to be a thing. I'm an artist and in the current moment it just seems like a load of unnecessary crap that's just being splurged out there for money. But maybe that's just my potato brain and not understanding the potential of it.

Buying an NFT is the same as someone buying 100 stuffed animals from china for 10 cents each, drawing a mustache on one, and selling it for a million dollars cause they said it was "special". Except you cant screenshot a stuffed animal.

My biggest problem with NFTs is that they are made to honour art and help artists....but we don't hear some individual's art which he put actual effort into sell for 1 million dollars instead we do hear a lot about ugly monkeys and no effort pixel arts to go for so so much money than their artistic value...
The fact that NFTs have basically become snake oil to an extent is very funny to me

All the artists I follow on twitter are vehemently against NFTs, but outsiders sell their shit for so much money with zero repercussions. It's the exact opposite of beneficial to artists unless you're banksy or some shit
Still have no idea why NFT's should exist :V

I'm so glad someone else shared my thoughts about those ugly ape NFTs. I feel like puking every time I see one. Who looks at these and goes "Wow, art!". Every time I mention how hideous they are I get attacked by the NFT community. I love NFT art that actually looks cool and has effort put into it. I wish it was more about creating good art than just trying to make so much money. Sell your art pieces for the prices they actually deserve.
Peter Schiff had a good point about them (NFTs), they should be used for licenses and proof of ownership (titles, certificates of birth/marriage etc).

Despite Felix's very educated explanation...

I still do not understand what exactly NFTs are and how they serve any purpose
I feel like NFT's are just a legitimized, socially accepted, form of investment for scammers.
Too many artists being overwhelmed by art theft for me to believe NFTs are anything but shady. Till there's better verification it's a joke. Remember to hydrate and touch grass before it all burns!
I like how your channel gives honest opinions about stuff.

That dead look in Keanu's eyes as the guy is explaining the overfilled queue for intangible digital items...
"Humans are doomed. We have failed."
I hate NFTs man. The cons far far far outweigh the pros. Grifters love them though cause it has never been easier to scam people.
NFTs are another way rich people can launder money, in a more convenient way instead of real art pieces
I love how the NFT doesn't even needed prove or process about art. Just who stole it and upload first, who gets the money.

Nftards: "Nft is about supporting the artists"

Also Nftards: steals random artists artwork without their consent
You could sue the person that made an NFT of you. I don’t think they can legally sell something with your likeness on it without your permission.

My distaste of NFTs can be boiled down to two main issues: 
1. Art Theft
2. Lack of restrictions against generative art

It just mind boggles me that there are people out there that rather spend a lifetime fortune owning an imaginary item, than to spend it where real people might actually need for housing, food, clothes etc

The human race is just crazy
NFT completely failed to be for the artist, not even mentioning the fact that there is still a big environmental impact to be fixed
The amount of energy required to upkeep the electronic receipts, blockchain, whatever, for NFTs is devastatingly horrible for the environment

When you have a “product” whose price is based entirely on hype and not any material value, the sky is the limit - and the internet is a hype machine. It doesn’t matter at all what the “art” is because the value is in the hype, not the art. But I think you can easily predict the long term stability of this kind of hype: the internet does not have a long attention span or memory. If you bought a $10M “dat boi” NFT several years ago, holding that value is an impossibility. This is day-trading gambles, not some hodl investment situation. (and also maybe the cremation of art’s defiled corpse)
As much as pewds hated marvel, he still condemn people using his name for NFT sh*ts. That's how much a legend Stan Lee is

"I think it's a cool
 idea, has a ton of potential and it's actually really interesting. Except that it's not"
He had me in the first half. Not gonna lie.
My favorites are NFT owners starting a RightClickVictim hashtag, and another legit asked: “What has the Mona Lisa contributed to art or history?”
Never underestimate the power of the screen shot.
If I get the million I'm buying a house for my family. And replacing the old abandoned middle school with a homeless shelter and addictions counseling unit.
The news about the NFT, that's what I call an epic fiasco

My grandpa always told my dad, "A fool and his money are soon parted." 
Never thought it could ever be applied this way, but the world is filled with rich fools.
that keanu reeves laugh was like a critikal laugh. they’ve been the same person the whole time!!!
Thats why its better to have tangible assets.
Imagine actually spending money on NFT, when you can just screenshot it

When the 2017 Pewdiepie Kicks in :
0:27
NFTs are just overpriced stock images
Why are we as a society NOT hunting down who “okay’d ” that Stan Lee thing & making their life hell?
After a thousands of explanation, I still don’t understand what is NFT

The movie "The Congress" goes over this kind of digital world were about to enter. It stars Robyn Wright as herself (kinda meta) in an aging world where they want to scan her and use her image to create more movies. Things happen. I do NOT recommend watching the trailer. Its a good movie that gets spoiled with the trailer so if it sounds interesting to you guys, check it out! HIGHLY RECOMMEND if youre into VR, meta worlds, digital art, etc. Crazy too because this movie was made in 2013....
NFTs reaching a new low is impossible, it already lives in the basement of the universe.
Damn, poor Stan Lee. Dude didn't even get the money he deserved when Disney was cashing and still is cashing in...now people are using his likeness for this scam? It's disgusting.

This is how every new technology works. Computers, phones, mobile communication etc. There's a huge monetary incentive early on and weird, bad attempts at captilizing, especially once the tech leaves the military/public domain and enters the private or commercial world.

I'm a traditional artist. I aspire to be like the old masters who's artworks had transcended through time and people still get to appreciate today. Just when I thought art world had reached the all time low with modern art, surprise surprise, NFT swept that off of its feet.

"NFTs is about supporting artists, I swear"

Also NFTs: *steals another artist's work*

What cracks me up about the Stan Lee thing is gonna get me cancelled, even though I don't have any videos.

They used a Jewish man to promote a shady money-grab in the form of a superhero with a six-pointed star on his chest.

I get it, it's supposed to look like a chakram or something...but then they also make a token with Stan wearing the outfit!

Intentional? 
Unlikely.
Tone deaf? 
What did you say?
I literally got an NFT ad for this video
I think after Beeple sold his art for 69 mil, NFTs just hit a new low. Bad art all around and more prioritize to the money and not to the art itself

You know you can just screenshot all the NFTs in a collection and just resell them as your own collection in Solana Chain or Ethereum if you have the money for gas fees. This will effectively destroy the original collection. 

"It's not about the money its about sending a message"
You know that Nfts are bad when even South Park talked about it
The fact that NFT exist and its getting bigger with so many celebrities supporting it, showing how shitty our world are now
Your not alone I agree 100% on the whole NFT thing. I’m the beginning I thought it was a cool idea but the way it’s been going since has just sucked
3:02 this part is gold for a YLYL video , lmao !!
In a perfect world without greed, NFTs are a great idea. But this aint a perfect world.
2:08 you have no idea what you did by showing that in your video. Now that you have acknowledged the existence of that nft, people will ACTUALLY go find that and buy that for thousands of dollars.
Really dissapointed in what NFTs turned into, I was excited for them to be a tool for digital artists. Hopefully that bubble bursts and we actually get people doing cool things with them

I am happy to see Felix having a good, levelheaded take. NFT has potential but it's definitely being misused and mainly just used as either scams or just pump and dump schemes. So I agree with Pewds, NFTs cool as a concept but it'll suck until people stop misusing it.
